news_header: Nigeria will use $52.9 million recovered from former oil minister Diezani Alison-Madueke for rural electrification projects, following a US-Nigeria asset return agreement.
news_text: The Nigerian government announced that $52.9 million recovered from former Petroleum Resources Minister Diezani Alison-Madueke will fund rural electrification projects. This follows a US-Nigeria Asset Return Agreement, marking the first repatriation of assets linked to Alison-Madueke. The funds are part of a broader effort to combat corruption, with Nigerian Justice Minister Lateef Fagbemi emphasizing international cooperation in addressing corruption and its impact on public resources. The funds will be managed by the World Bank to improve renewable energy access in rural areas, with additional funds allocated for counterterrorism measures.
